dict.string:
Forces the keyboard to use a specific type. Some examples are listed below.
0 = Standard (i.e. no extra period key) 1 = No emoji key 2 = Open w/@123 KB, no emoji key 3 = No space bar/dictation key (replaced by ".", "/" and ".com" keys) 4 = # pad 5 = # pad + "+*#" key 7 = No dictation key (adds "@" and "." keys) 8 = # pad + "." key 9 = No return key (replaced by "@" and "#" keys) 10 = Adds "." key and changes "Return" to "Go"
NOTE: This may be more useful on a per app basis (i.e. you always want a specific KB for a specific app). If this is the case, I suggest replicating this patch for said app.
[v.1] Tested with 9.0.2. (12-4-15)
☞PayPal: goin730@gmail.com
